name: Jin Sun 0007
content: Home - Jin Sun Jin Sun Assistant Professor School of Computing | Institute for AI University of Georgia 804 Boyd Graduate Studies Research Center Athens, GA, USA 30602 jinsun@uga.edu I'm an Assistant Professor in the School of Computing and a faculty fellow at the Institute for Artificial Intelligence at the University of Georgia. I'm also a Lilly Teaching Fellow. My main research area is computer vision--understanding our world using visual data with the help of state-of-the-art deep learning models. In particular, I'm passionate about understanding people in diverse and complex environment using images and videos. I believe A.I. can and should be developed to improve people's quality of life. I am actively collaborating with researchers across disciplines to apply A.I. in scientific discovery, healthcare advancement, and societal challenges, aiming to create meaningful impact beyond traditional computer vision applications. Recent news May, 2025 New conference paper accepted at KDD 2025. May, 2025 New conference paper accepted at ICML 2025. Feb, 2025 New conference paper accepted at ICLR 2025. Jan, 2025 United States Department of Transportation (USDOT) grant awarded as Co-PI. Dec, 2024 New journal paper accepted at Ageing Research Reviews. Sep, 2024 National Institutes of Health (NIH) R21 grant awarded as PI. Sep, 2024 University of Georgia, College of Engineering, Engineering and Computing Convergence Collaboration innovations (EC3) grant awarded as Co-PI. Aug, 2024 New journal paper accepted at Biosystems Engineering. Jun, 2024 New conference paper accepted at NeurIPS 2024. May, 2024 New journal paper accepted at Computers and Electronics in Agriculture. Jan, 2024 University of Georgia, Presidential Interdisciplinary Seed Grant awarded as Co-PI.
